title: Do plagiarism checkers store the paper while checking for plagiarism? - Quora

response.answer_text: All plagiarism checkers have different policies of their own. Turnitin and other top plagiarism checkers have been accused of storing people’s data. Here is the list of plagiarism checkers that store the paper: Turnitin: It includes papers and also shares with other people and companies. It writes in their terms and condition, you give them exclusive right for it (Not recommended for individuals)Viper: It saves papers and sells them to third parties. (Not recommended)Grammarly: This grammar and plagiarism checker saves papers but DOESN’T SHARE with anyone. (Recommended)Plagiarism checkers that don’t store your papers Plagiarism Checker X: It is a multilingual plagiarism checker that is safe and powerful. It doesn’t save your data. (Recommended if you don’t need Grammar checker)ProWritingAid: This is a plagiarism checker and grammar checker that is also not interested to save your papers in the database. It doesn’t have an attractive interface like Grammarly but it’s better in performance (Recommended)There are maximum chances that if there is a free plagiarism checker it must be saving your paper. Because there is no other reason to create a free plagiarism checker. Developers and owners need to money. This is why free tools are not recommended for academic purposes.

Every plagiarism checker has it's own policy. Recently some cases were lost against iParadigms. Here is preliminary list of checkers and evaluation of their copyright policy, gathered from internet, when i researched plagiarism checker's policies: Plagramme - doesn't include papers to database Turnitin - includes Noplag - includes Paper rater - doesn't include papers to database Unplag - doesn't include include papers to database Plagscan - doesn't include include papers to database Plagtracker - doesn't include include papers to database
